message.content:
A 'Trillium flexipes' is a perennial flowering plant that belongs to the Trillium family.
It is characterized by three large, white petals which are rounded at their tips.
The petals are supported by a central stalk or peduncle, which is covered with tiny hairs.
The leaves of the plant are broad and green, and emerge from the base of the peduncle.
The flowers are typically about 2-3 inches in diameter and have a slightly spicy scent.
'Trillium flexipes' can be found in woodlands, along stream banks, and in other moist, shaded environments.
It is often used as an ornamental plant in gardens or as a wildflower in naturalized landscapes.
